monster.name: Screecher
languages: Understands Abyssal but can't speak it

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The Screecher has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The Screecher has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the Screecher's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The Screecher can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack.
entries: The Screecher makes two bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) piercing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Thunderous Screech {@recharge 5}
entries: The screecher creates an ear-splitting screech. Each creature within 30ft must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) thunder damage and has the {@condition deafened} condition until the start of the screechers next turn. On a successful save a creature takes half as much damage. The screech can be heard within 300ft.

monster.name: Blood Zombie
languages: Understands languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Blood Fury.
entries: While it has 13 hit points or fewer, the blood lily zombie has advantage on attack rolls. In addition, it deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage to any target it hits with a melee attack.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the blood zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the blood zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Ethereal Digby is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 15}, +7 to hit with spell attacks). Ethereal Digby has the following Wizard spells prepared:

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) Piercing damage.

reaction.name: Shield
entries: {@spell shield}

reaction.name: Absorb Elements
entries: {@spell absorb elements|xge}

trait.name: Literally Three Goblins
entries: When Three Goblins in a Trenchcoat uses its action to make an attack, each living Goblin gets 1 attack action. When Three Goblins in a Trenchcoat drops below 33% HP (27) a random one of the goblins dies, then again when the monster drops below 15% HP (12).

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: When the Top Goblin hits an enemy with a dagger attack, it may deal {@damage 2d6} extra damage if there is another goblin still alive in the trenchcoat.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Middle Goblin is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is WIS (spell save {@dc 13}, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The Middle Goblin has following Druid spells prepared:

action.name: Fighter (Bottom Goblin)
entries: Handaxe. Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., 1 target. {@h} 7 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Druid (Middle Goblin)
entries: Club. Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5ft., 1 target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rogue (Top Goblin)
entries: Dagger. Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5ft. (20/60), 1 target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Actually Three Goblins
entries: The goblins get one attack per goblin in the trenchcoat that is alive.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Mooper is a 3rd level spellcaster. Spellcasting ability is Charisma ({@dc 15}, +7 to hit.)

trait.name: Eepy
entries: When the Mooper feels safe, they must succeed a {@dc 7} Wisdom saving throw or fall asleep. The DC increases by 1 every hour of feeling safe.

trait.name: Chronic Liar
entries: When the Mooper is in a conversation they must succeed a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the Mooper cannot resist lying to whoever the other conversationist is.

action.name: Stylus
entries: The Mooper attacks ferociously with her stylus. {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

Standing a mere 5 feet 1 inch tall, the Mooper is a quirky, small humanoid with an aura of chaotic charm. Its mischievous eyes seem to dance with unspoken jokes and secrets, leaving those it encounters unsure of what’s true and what’s a clever fabrication. Despite their odd habits, Moopers are surprisingly endearing and oddly resourceful, often weaving fantastical tales so convincingly that even they sometimes forget the truth. However, their penchant for spontaneous napping—dubbed "eepying" by those who know them—has thwarted more than a few of their own schemes. When not asleep or spinning wild yarns, Moopers can be formidable spellcasters, blending humor and trickery with potent magic. Few adventurers can claim to have met a Mooper and walked away without a memorable (if baffling) tale to tell.

bonus.name: Platonic Charm
entries: As a bonus action, the Mooper can increase friendly morale and lust with 60 ft. until the start of her next turn.

trait.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
entries: The big guy can communicate simple concepts to frogs and toads when it speaks in deep speech.

trait.name: Light Sensitivity
entries: While in bright light, the big guy has disadvantage on attack rolls and Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight. Wearing kirkland sunglasses negates the effects of this trait.

trait.name: Congested
entries: Every minute the big guy has to make a {@dc 10} constitution saving throw. On a failure, the big guy clears his throat.

action.name: Accidental Moan
entries: Each creature within 60 feet of the big guy that can hear its moan and that isn't an aberration must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end of the big guy's next turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the big guy's moan for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Stone Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage. The big guy uses the earth to bludgeon another creature.

bonus.name: Vocal Stim (1/day)
entries: The big guy begins to stim making random noises. The big guy has advantage on Wisdom saving throws for 1 hour.
